images.caption: Figure 1:Method Families for Zero-Shot Human Activity Recognition.
Figure 2:Overall architecture of ZARA, a motion TS analysis agent augmented with prior knowledge and retrieval.
Figure 3:ZARAâ€™s hierarchical multi-agent workflow with placement-specific, class-wise evidence retrieval and rank fusion.

Figure 4:Subject split and data flow.
ZARA builds its vector database and domain knowledge from seen subjects and tests on held-out subjects.
Baselines may load pretrained weights and, when needed, train a classifier head on the database split before evaluating on the same held-out subjects.

Figure 5:Impact of Retrieval onEvidence PruningandDecision and InsightAgents. Theupper boundindicates the proportion of queries for which the pruned candidate set still contains the correct class under each setting.
Figure 6:Accuracy with and without theEvidence PruningAgent, along with upper bounds for each setting. The dashed line indicates the average length of the pruned candidate set.
Figure 7:Impact of prior knowledge injection on initial and secondaryFeature Selectoragents.
